Key Match Events: Bradley Beal came off the bench for the first time in nine years and scored a team-high 25 points.
Phoenix Suns snapped a four-game losing streak with a 109-99 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers.
Beal scored 20 points in the second half as Phoenix overcame an early 12-point deficit.
Post-Match Reflections: Bradley Beal accepted coach Mike Budenholzer's lineup change but made it clear he considers himself a starter in the NBA.
Coach Mike Budenholzer stated that the lineup change was necessary to figure out the best combinations for success.
Beal and Jusuf Nurkic gave the Suns' bench a huge boost, contributing significantly to the win.
